item.description:
City Wide Open Studios at Erector Square

Come join us and explore the studios at Erector Square. Get there on time as anyone who has been there will tell you the building is like a maze and it may be difficult to find us once we get started. Mingle with Artist and learn about their creative process over light snacks and beverages. You may want to bring your wallet. ;- )

Explore the artistic riches of New Haven with City-Wide Open Studios! It's a large-scale convening of visual artists from across Connecticut in studios and temporary spaces around New Haven.

The festival will take place over three weekends in October 2012. A central hub exhibition at Artspace will feature one representative work from each participating artist. Also, to celebrate the festival's 15th year, its Crystal Anniversary, we will feature art and events on the theme crystal.

Free and open to the public,CWOS a wonderful opportunity to see artists at work and buy affordable art directly from them.

Erector Square (315 Peck Street) acts as a hub of artistic activity in Fair Haven. A high concentration of artist studios—housed in a former Erector Set factory—make it an especially exciting place to be during Open Studios. Explore the personal studios of hundreds of local artists on your own or through a guided tour. Artspace volunteers will be on hand with maps, schedules of demonstrations and directions for visitors.
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the front of the Erector Square parking lot on the sidewalk, will where the Black and White Scarf with piano keys
item.name: City Wide Open Studio
